Discussion.Thread: How long did the Black Death truly last?
Discussion.Content: Black Death lasted for 4 years from 1347 to 1351.

Discussion.Thread: How long did the Black Death truly last?
Discussion.Content: Contrary to popular belief, the Black Death didn't just sweep through Europe for a few years. Rather, it came and went every few decades for centuries, as suggested by multiple population graphs from the time.

Discussion.Thread: How long did the Black Death truly last?
Discussion.Content: But is it fair to say the Black Death lasted for centuries? After all, the Black Death that people usually refer to is from that one time period.

Timeline: Black Death starts in Central Asia
Mongolians lay siege on Feodosia, spreading the disease
Genovese merchants spread it to Europe

Discussion.Thread: Was Humanism truly a concept prevalent in Europe at the time, or a mere justification of what happened that those who came after made up?
Discussion.Content: It is clear that Europeans at the time recognised their changes as something unorthodox

Timeline: Boccaccio and early Humanists start writing, painting and crafting about nature, human emotions and other 'unworthy' stuff
